summary: From Good Omens, (by Gaiman and Pratchett) three pages into the chapter, “Fifteen Years Ago” This watch gave Crowley the time in...
caption:
From Good Omens, (by Gaiman and Pratchett) three pages into the chapter, “Fifteen Years Ago”

This watch gave Crowley the time in twenty world capitals and a capital city in Another Place, where it was always one time, and that was Too Late. 

What if it’s too late to try and be a better person?

summary: Crowley & Aziraphale for the ask game
question: Crowley & Aziraphale for the ask game
answer:
Crowley:

  • First impression: After just the first few pages, I thought he seemed like a super cool dude
  • Impression now: Huge dumbass energy, this one
  • Favorite moment: It changes all the time, but right now I keep thinking about the graveyard scene and how that should have been where I realized he’s just a dork
  • Idea for a story: Right now…origin story for that damn necklace
  • Unpopular opinion: Crowley is bisexual.
  • Favorite relationship: INEFFABLE HUSBANDSSSSS
  • Favorite headcanon: Crowley is bisexual.

Aziraphale:

  • First impression: standard “English, intelligent, and gay” thing
  • Impression now: English, dumb as fuck, and gay
  • Favorite moment: Possessing all those random people and highkey judging all of them
  • Idea for a story: NECKLACE, also, ya know, I need to get to that requested second chapter of the fem!Aziraphale fic
  • Unpopular opinion: the mean things he says to Crowley (i.e. not being able to comprehend love) probably hurt Crowley’s feelings, even if he doesn’t 100% believe what he says or intend it as hurtful
  • Favorite relationship: IN. EFFABLE. FUCKING. HUSBANDS.
  • Favorite headcanon: He’s incredibly uncomfortable in his human body even though he’s been in if for 6,000+ years give or take, depending on whether or not he’s ever actually been discorporated. That’s why he always sits so stiffly. He didn’t learn that from gentlemanly high society. He just happened to fit in well under the guise of a high society gentleman because of it.

Katherine, 22 lesbian she/her UK
Good Omens, Star Trek and any other hyperfixations

tags: pls did you like it did you not a few points on acting cinematography and some background
summary:
I just read every single review of Good Omens that's been published online and honestly TV reviews are the worst.
The...
body:
I just read every single review of Good Omens that’s been published online and honestly TV reviews are the worst.

  • The broadsheets reviewers try to find fault in thing no casual viewer gives a shit about for takes
  • The ‘highbrow’ publications simply try to prove to you how many references they understood (while pretentiously explaining to the reader why the obscure thing reminded them of some other obscure thing aren’t we all so clever for knowing what Monty python is)
  • The genre (sci-fi/comic) based sites just seem to narrate the entire plot while giving every actors’ entire CV
  • And then the 'viral’ obsessed publication just make loads of weird irrelevant references to other shows to try and excite fandom

Thanks for your opinion???? I think???

  • The genre (sci-fi/comic) based sites just seem to narrate the entire plot while giving every actors’ entire CV
  • And then the 'viral’ obsessed publication just make loads of weird irrelevant references to other shows to try and excite fandom

Thanks for your opinion???? I think???

summary: so a whole bunch of reviews of Good Omens came out today (I guess this could be spoiler-y, but there’s nothing specific?) and I...
body:
so a whole bunch of reviews of Good Omens came out today (I guess this could be spoiler-y, but there’s nothing specific?) and I

[Crowley] and Aziraphale have a teasing, love/hate relationship that fans of the book have shipped for almost two decades. Gaiman has since promised that “the TV series gets deeper into Crowley and Aziraphale’s relationship,” and some viewers will be hoping that that will translate into a burgeoning romance.

Certainly in episode one, Aziraphale seems rather overexcited at the prospect of he and Crowley becoming joint “godfathers” to the infant Antichrist…. [x]

am

[T]hey both realize they’ve got some degree of free will and are able, in some small capacity, to live their lives for themselves (and one another). At least, that’s what they believe to be true….

Aziraphale and Crowley’s chemistry with one another is a core component of their characterizations in the book and Tennant and Sheen capture them both brilliantly with just the right blend of genuine tenderness and exasperation. Neither of them directly say it to one another, but Crowley and Aziraphale are more than friends or partners in any mortal sense of the words, they’re the only people in existence who can understand one another and can’t conceive of existing without being connected. [x]

absolutely

Michael Sheen’s portrayal of the angel’s awkward meekness and affection gives the friendship between Aziraphale and Crowley the feeling of a much deeper bond. [x]

fucking

Crowley and Aziraphale have been around forever and share something that might be a little more than friendship…. [x]

incapacitated

Their push-pull dynamic is as playful as it is stealthily romantic, something the show leans into as it becomes clear that their friendship is the heart of the series. [x]

like

[T]he focus on the characters mean it is, at its heart, a love story between these two unlikely companions whose friendship has lasted since the beginning of time. And they aren’t about to allow something as trivial as the oncoming war between heaven and hell break them apart. [x]

help!!!!!

blog.name: tinsnip
blog.title: No, said Aziraphale, it's ineffable.
blog.description:
Hello, I'm tinsnip.

Feeling rather ineffable these days. Expect a great deal of Good Omens.

Other interests: Star Trek. (Primarily DS9 and Cardassians.)
Pratchett. Wodehouse.
Cats. The Doctors Whom. Science. Cute things. Life truths. Pixels. And spiders, sometimes, so keep that in mind.

I post fic on AO3. It's quite good - you should have a look.

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

source: Good Omens Review: An Apocalypse We’d Be Lucky to Live Through

May 31st is coming up!

Sometimes I’ll remember a scene from Good Omens, and do a double take like; “Did that really happen? Did those nerds do that? Must of because I couldn’t have made it up.”

summary: Aziraphale owns a Soho bookshop, and likes gravlax salmon with dill sauce. Crowley drives a pristine 1926 Bentley and listens to...
text:
Aziraphale owns a Soho bookshop, and likes gravlax salmon with dill sauce. Crowley drives a pristine 1926 Bentley and listens to Queen. They’ve formed a professional agreement not to meddle in each other’s affairs, and in their spare time they’ve enjoyed a series of rather nice clandestine lunches. 

Every time either actor appears onscreen, you can almost hear the costume department’s (and fandom’s) squeals of joy. David Tennant in snakeskin boots! Michael Sheen with artfully tousled bleached hair! A tartan bow tie!
source: Good Omens Amazon BBC TV series spoiler-free review: Michael Sheen and David Tennant shine in Neil Gaiman’s love letter to the book - Radio Times

reblog.comment: Good Omens Amazon BBC TV series spoiler-free review: Michael Sheen and David Tennant shine in Neil Gaiman’s love letter to the book - Radio Times

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

summary: But despite the amount of material it covers, the first hour is still brisk because of Tennant and Sheen’s sublime...
text: But despite the amount of material it covers, the first hour is still brisk because of Tennant and Sheen’s sublime chemistry. Tennant, who has the difficult job of acting behind sunglasses for the majority of the series, is pure rock-star charisma on a stick, all swagger and sex and fabulous hairstyles. But Sheen is next-level good, purity and sweetness radiating from his eyes and posture — somehow making his Aziraphale’s foppish, fussy nature seem completely endearing rather than irritating. Good Omens cleverly invests in Crowley and Aziraphale’s relationship, scattering sequences of the pair meeting throughout history and occasionally saving each other’s lives. A whole show could be made of just Sheen and Tennant’s characters getting into history (for you Doctor Who fans out there, there’s a fun nod to the Shakespeare episode). Their push-pull dynamic is as playful as it is stealthily romantic, something the show leans into as it becomes clear that their friendship is the heart of the series.
source: Good Omens Review: Tennant and Sheen Are a Heavenly Duo – /Film

summary: Snakes don’t like the cold much. Pre-Arrangement(1) obviously. (1) Despite not having come to their Arrangement yet, the wound...
caption:
Snakes don’t like the cold much. Pre-Arrangement(1) obviously.

(1) Despite not having come to their Arrangement yet, the wound on Aziraphale was actually an accident. Neither was very good at the whole ‘adversary’ thing.
